trans-unit.source: Add apps | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Add apps | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Before you start deploying apps with Intune, take some time to familiarize yourself with the concepts introduced in this topic.
trans-unit.target: Before you start deploying apps with Intune, take some time to familiarize yourself with the concepts introduced in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Add apps with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Add apps with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Before you start deploying apps with Microsoft Intune, take some time to familiarize yourself with the concepts introduced in this topic.
trans-unit.target: Before you start deploying apps with Microsoft Intune, take some time to familiarize yourself with the concepts introduced in this topic.

trans-unit.source: These concepts will help you understand which apps you can deploy to which platform.
trans-unit.target: These concepts will help you understand which apps you can deploy to which platform.

trans-unit.source: They'll also help you understand the prerequisites that must be in place before you deploy the apps.
trans-unit.target: They'll also help you understand the prerequisites that must be in place before you deploy the apps.

trans-unit.source: App types that you can deploy
trans-unit.target: App types that you can deploy

trans-unit.source: Software installer
trans-unit.target: Software installer

trans-unit.source: App type
trans-unit.target: App type

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Windows Installer (*.exe, *.msi)
trans-unit.target: Windows Installer (*.exe, *.msi)

trans-unit.source: This type of app must support silent installation with no user input.
trans-unit.target: This type of app must support silent installation with no user input.

trans-unit.source: Your app documentation should include the relevant command-line options to silently install the app (for example, **/q**).
trans-unit.target: Your app documentation should include the relevant command-line options to silently install the app (for example, **/q**).

trans-unit.source: You can find a list of common command-line options in [Command-Line Switches for the Microsoft Windows Installer Tool](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/227091).
trans-unit.target: You can find a list of common command-line options in [Command-Line Switches for the Microsoft Windows Installer Tool](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/227091).

trans-unit.source: Any additional files and folders that the app’s setup program requires must be available from the location that you specify for the app setup files.
trans-unit.target: Any additional files and folders that the app’s setup program requires must be available from the location that you specify for the app setup files.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, Windows Installer (.msi) and Windows Installer Patch (.msp) files do not require Intune to install any command-line arguments.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, Windows Installer (.msi) and Windows Installer Patch (.msp) files do not require Intune to install any command-line arguments.

trans-unit.source: Check your app documentation.
trans-unit.target: Check your app documentation.

trans-unit.source: If command-line arguments are required, they must be entered as Name=Value pairs (such as TRANSFORMS=custom_transform.mst).
trans-unit.target: If command-line arguments are required, they must be entered as Name=Value pairs (such as TRANSFORMS=custom_transform.mst).

trans-unit.source: App Package for Android (*.apk)
trans-unit.target: App Package for Android (*.apk)

trans-unit.source: To deploy Android apps, you must have a valid .apk package.
trans-unit.target: To deploy Android apps, you must have a valid .apk package.

trans-unit.source: App Package for iOS (*.ipa)
trans-unit.target: App Package for iOS (*.ipa)

trans-unit.source: To deploy iOS apps, you must have a valid .ipa package.
trans-unit.target: To deploy iOS apps, you must have a valid .ipa package.

trans-unit.source: The .ipa package must be signed by Apple, and the expiration date in the provisioning profile must be valid.
trans-unit.target: The .ipa package must be signed by Apple, and the expiration date in the provisioning profile must be valid.

trans-unit.source: Intune can distribute enterprise certificate iOS applications.
trans-unit.target: Intune can distribute enterprise certificate iOS applications.

trans-unit.source: Not all Apple developer certificate apps are supported.
trans-unit.target: Not all Apple developer certificate apps are supported.

trans-unit.source: Your company must be registered for the iOS Developer Enterprise Program.
trans-unit.target: Your company must be registered for the iOS Developer Enterprise Program.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that your organization’s firewall allows access to the iOS provisioning and certification websites.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that your organization’s firewall allows access to the iOS provisioning and certification websites.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to deploy a manifest file (.plist) with the app.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to deploy a manifest file (.plist) with the app.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone app package (*.xap, .appx, .appxbundle)
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone app package (*.xap, .appx, .appxbundle)

trans-unit.source: To deploy apps, you'll need an enterprise mobile code-signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: To deploy apps, you'll need an enterprise mobile code-signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-windows-phone-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Set up Windows Phone management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-windows-phone-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Windows app package (.appx, .appxbundle)
trans-unit.target: Windows app package (.appx, .appxbundle)

trans-unit.source: To deploy apps, you'll need an enterprise mobile code-signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: To deploy apps, you'll need an enterprise mobile code-signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Set up Windows device management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-windows-device-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Set up Windows device management with Microsoft Intune](set-up-windows-device-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Windows Installer through MDM (*.msi)
trans-unit.target: Windows Installer through MDM (*.msi)

trans-unit.source: You use this app to create and deploy Windows Installer-based apps to enrolled PCs that run Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: You use this app to create and deploy Windows Installer-based apps to enrolled PCs that run Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: These PCs are managed through mobile device management (MDM).
trans-unit.target: These PCs are managed through mobile device management (MDM).

trans-unit.source: You can upload only a single file with the extension .msi.
trans-unit.target: You can upload only a single file with the extension .msi.

trans-unit.source: The file's product code and product version are used for app detection.
trans-unit.target: The file's product code and product version are used for app detection.

trans-unit.source: The default restart behavior of the app will be used.
trans-unit.target: The default restart behavior of the app will be used.

trans-unit.source: Intune does not control this.
trans-unit.target: Intune does not control this.

trans-unit.source: Per-user MSI packages will be installed for a single user.
trans-unit.target: Per-user MSI packages will be installed for a single user.

trans-unit.source: Per-machine MSI packages will be installed for all users on the device.
trans-unit.target: Per-machine MSI packages will be installed for all users on the device.

trans-unit.source: Dual-mode MSI packages are currently installed only for all users on the device.
trans-unit.target: Dual-mode MSI packages are currently installed only for all users on the device.

trans-unit.source: App updates are supported when the MSI product code of each version is the same.
trans-unit.target: App updates are supported when the MSI product code of each version is the same.

trans-unit.source: All software installer app types are uploaded to your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: All software installer app types are uploaded to your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: External Link
trans-unit.target: External Link

trans-unit.source: Use an external link when you have a:
trans-unit.target: Use an external link when you have a:

trans-unit.source: URL that lets users download an app from an app store.
trans-unit.target: URL that lets users download an app from an app store.

trans-unit.source: Link to a web-based app that runs from the web browser.
trans-unit.target: Link to a web-based app that runs from the web browser.

trans-unit.source: Apps based on external links are not stored in your Intune cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: Apps based on external links are not stored in your Intune cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: Managed iOS app from the app store
trans-unit.target: Managed iOS app from the app store

trans-unit.source: You can use managed iOS apps to manage and deploy iOS apps that are free of charge from the app store.
trans-unit.target: You can use managed iOS apps to manage and deploy iOS apps that are free of charge from the app store.

trans-unit.source: You can also use managed iOS apps to associate [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) with [compatible apps](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx) and review their status in the administrator console.
trans-unit.target: You can also use managed iOS apps to associate [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) with [compatible apps](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx) and review their status in the administrator console.

trans-unit.source: Managed iOS apps are not stored in your Intune cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: Managed iOS apps are not stored in your Intune cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: Options for mobile devices are not available until you [set the MDM authority](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md) to Intune.
trans-unit.target: Options for mobile devices are not available until you [set the MDM authority](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md) to Intune.

trans-unit.source: Intune software publisher
trans-unit.target: Intune software publisher

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Intune Software Publisher starts when you add or modify apps from the Intune administrator console.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Intune Software Publisher starts when you add or modify apps from the Intune administrator console.

trans-unit.source: From the publisher, you select and configure a software installer type that will either:
trans-unit.target: From the publisher, you select and configure a software installer type that will either:

trans-unit.source: Upload apps (programs for computers or apps for mobile devices) to be stored in Intune cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: Upload apps (programs for computers or apps for mobile devices) to be stored in Intune cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: Link to an online store or web application.
trans-unit.target: Link to an online store or web application.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin to use the software publisher, you must install the full version of [Microsoft .NET Framework 4.0](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=17851).
trans-unit.target: Before you begin to use the software publisher, you must install the full version of [Microsoft .NET Framework 4.0](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=17851).

trans-unit.source: After installation, you might have to restart your computer before the software publisher will open correctly.
trans-unit.target: After installation, you might have to restart your computer before the software publisher will open correctly.

trans-unit.source: Cloud storage space
trans-unit.target: Cloud storage space

trans-unit.source: All apps that you create by using the software installer installation type (for example, a line-of-business app) are packaged and uploaded to Microsoft Intune cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: All apps that you create by using the software installer installation type (for example, a line-of-business app) are packaged and uploaded to Microsoft Intune cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: A trial subscription of Intune includes 2 gigabytes (GB) of cloud-based storage that is used to store managed apps and updates.
trans-unit.target: A trial subscription of Intune includes 2 gigabytes (GB) of cloud-based storage that is used to store managed apps and updates.

trans-unit.source: Your full subscription includes 20 GB of storage space.
trans-unit.target: Your full subscription includes 20 GB of storage space.

trans-unit.source: You can see how much space you are using in the **Storage Use** node of the **Admin** workspace.
trans-unit.target: You can see how much space you are using in the **Storage Use** node of the **Admin** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for cloud storage space are as follows:
trans-unit.target: Requirements for cloud storage space are as follows:

trans-unit.source: All app installation files must be in the same folder.
trans-unit.target: All app installation files must be in the same folder.

trans-unit.source: The maximum file size for any file that you upload is 2 GB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum file size for any file that you upload is 2 GB.

trans-unit.source: Support for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Support for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 PCs do not require a sideloading key to install line-of-business apps.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 PCs do not require a sideloading key to install line-of-business apps.

trans-unit.source: However, the registry key **HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Appx\AllowAllTrustedApps** must have a value of to **1** to enable sideloading.
trans-unit.target: However, the registry key **HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Appx\AllowAllTrustedApps** must have a value of to **1** to enable sideloading.

trans-unit.source: If this registry key is not configured, Intune will automatically set this value to **1** the first time you deploy an app to the device.
trans-unit.target: If this registry key is not configured, Intune will automatically set this value to **1** the first time you deploy an app to the device.

trans-unit.source: If you set this value to **0**, Intune cannot automatically change the value, and the deployment of line-of-business apps will fail.
trans-unit.target: If you set this value to **0**, Intune cannot automatically change the value, and the deployment of line-of-business apps will fail.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform line-of-business apps must be signed with a code-signing certificate that is trusted on each device to which the app is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform line-of-business apps must be signed with a code-signing certificate that is trusted on each device to which the app is deployed.

trans-unit.source: You can use a certificate from an in-house public key infrastructure (PKI), or a certificate from a third-party public root certificate installed on the device.
trans-unit.target: You can use a certificate from an in-house public key infrastructure (PKI), or a certificate from a third-party public root certificate installed on the device.

trans-unit.source: On Windows 10 Mobile devices, you can use a non-Symantec code-signing certificate to sign universal **.appx** apps.
trans-unit.target: On Windows 10 Mobile devices, you can use a non-Symantec code-signing certificate to sign universal **.appx** apps.

trans-unit.source: For **.xap** apps, and also **.appx** packages built for Windows Phone 8.1 that you want to install on Windows 10 Mobile devices, you must use a Symantec code-signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: For **.xap** apps, and also **.appx** packages built for Windows Phone 8.1 that you want to install on Windows 10 Mobile devices, you must use a Symantec code-signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You'll need to add apps in the Intune console before you can deploy them.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to add apps in the Intune console before you can deploy them.

trans-unit.source: You can add apps for [enrolled devices](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md) or for [Windows PCs that you manage with the Intune client software](add-apps-for-windows-pcs-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: You can add apps for [enrolled devices](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md) or for [Windows PCs that you manage with the Intune client software](add-apps-for-windows-pcs-in-microsoft-intune.md).
